reviewText: This right now is my favorite show on television, right next to Intervention.  Like I have mentioned in previous reviews on other seasons of this show, I am very happy my wife introduced me to this show.  It's unbelievable what kind of evidence they tend to get and capture.  In my opinion, you can't really fabricate the evidence they end up with.  For any open minded skeptics, watch this show, it will blow your mind how great this show is!!!

reviewText: Like others have said, they (the Travel Channel) should have named these volumes instead of seasons. It's really confusing because there are several episodes of Season 4 on this Season 3 set. Like Season 2 had episodes from Season 3.From Season 4 we get:Rolling Hills SanitariumReturn to Bobby Mackey'sWaverly Hills SanitoriumHill View ManorVulture MineUSS HornetLa Palazza MansionFort ChaffeeAmargosa Opera HouseSo, what's missing that should be on the next Season 4 set?Gettysburg Orphanage/Jennie Wade House/Engine HouseStanley HotelOlde Fort ErieVillisca Axe Murder HouseKell's Irish Pub RestaurantPico House HotelReturn to Goldfield HotelBonnie Spring RanchSalem Witch House/Lyceum RestaurantJerome Grand HotelYorktown HospitalMadame Tussauds Wax MuseumSacramento TunnelsHales Bar Marina and DamKentucky Slave HouseTooele HospitalLoretta Lynn's Plantation HouseAnd last, but not least, the specials, Best Evidence and Scariest Moments. Perhaps at some point we could get the entire Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum live show as well. I won't hold my breath on that one, though. Love the guys and the show, but Travel Channel is messing with my head.

reviewText: Every season this show gets better. Zak, Nick and Aaron are our favorite guys to watch. Since we don't have cable this still give us the chance to follow them as they go on lockdowns to some of the most hunted place in America. Great entertainment, but might be too much for some younger children. They do a history of each place before hand and there can be some things that might not be suited to those younger viewers. The people who watch in our house are all over the age of 14. Will continue to buy each season!

reviewText: While I realize the DVD's may not match the episode seasons as they premiere on TV, it's misleading when ppl say there's duplicate episodes on the DVD seasons bought. Unlike Paranormal State where they HAVE just given longer versions of previous episodes and thrown it on a new disc; that is not the case with Ghost Adventures.My only complaint is the way the discs are set up. With shows like this where there's multiple episides, I like the choice of the 'PLAY ALL' option so they run consecutively. These discs don't have the play all option so you have to choose them individually.Other than that, what makes this show so different is their true passion to prove the existence of life after death/entities and spirits that still linger after death. They don't bring big camera crews (as they always say in their intro) which I really like. When they hear a sound, get an EVP, or see something, they make sure to not only show us what they've captured as the viewer, but they make sure to try and stay quiet after they initially freak out. I like this because they do their best to let us experience what they're experiencing.Ghost Hunters, Paranormal State, and other shows have seriously lacked in this department. On Paranormal State, I get so tired of seeing some camera angled at Ryan reacting to something.. yet we never know what he's reacting to beyond what he says he saw or heard. Even when they're all gathered around a computer screen in awe of some great evidence; we're stuck watching the crew reacting to watching the screen instead of us seeing what they're seeing.There's an episode where Chip Coffey freaks out because he says the doorknob turned on its own next to him. Ok, well since the camera was showing Chip and the doorknob was next him, why do we not see an enhanced view of what Chip was talking about? It's right there but we just have to take everyone's word and move on. They have background music playing so we can never hear much of anything ourselves either.Ghost Adventures on the other hand does everything humanly possible to show us not only what they've seen, heard, and felt.. but they show and have us listen no less than 3 times of what it was. They have still cameras set up in multiple rooms with the most activity to capture anything that might happen when they're not in that particular room. They don't try and claim that every bump in the night and every shadow must be paranormal either. As a matter of fact they go out of their way to debunk it or show you why it can't be anything other than paranormal. Zak, Nick, and Aaron all have very different personalities but the differences just work.This is absolutely my favorite paranormal show out there because they not only get a ridiculous amount of evidence, but we actually get to see it and hear it as it happens, as well as when they review the audio and video after their lockdown. Their passion for proving the existence of spirits/entities/ghosts is very real and you can sense that right away.This show is the only one out there that does it's best to let us experience every detail of what they're going through while keeping it as raw as possible as to not ruin things with added sight and sound effects later. What you see is what you get. Ghost Adventures is the best show out there for this genre of shows, and I can't wait for many more seasons to come.
summary: Awesome as always and NO duplicate episodes!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: As usual, The Ghost Adventures Crew with Zak, Nick, and Aaron, have collected a treasure trove of paranormal evidence and activity in Season 3. They also debunk these things, showing the audience exactly what they are all about. REAL, NO-NONSENSE, IN-YOUR-FACE, RAW, "Crack-This-Freakin'-Chair-Over-Zak's-Head-Instead-of-Making-Some-Dumb-A$$-Noises" crazy kinda' stuff! :P I swear, Zak would leave the location in an ambulance (if he really were to be attacked like that--yikes), and he'd be grinning from ear-to-ear, jibber-jabbering nonstop to the medics about his ghostly experience, and how UNBELIEVABLY AWESOME it was!! :D EXACTLY like the little kid with ADD he turns into whenever it comes to this stuff, LMAO.Sooo... Yisss... 'The Laugh-Riot' continues as we watch, listen, and observe the expertise of "'The Best of The Best" -- Zak Bagans, Nick Groff, and last... but definitely not least, Aaron Goodwin. They are NUMERO UNO in this field of study. "The 3 Stooges" of all things Paranormal (not to mention extremely and utterly HI-LARIOUS TO WATCH when they're all thrown in together during "The Lockdowns!") You'll be ROTFL one minute, and then all of a sudden, out of nowhere, you'll hear a LOUD crash or a bang. Followed by Aaron screaming at the top of his lungs like a lil' B!TCH, hehehe..., "OMG!! WHAT WAS THAT!?? DID YOU GUYS JUST HEAR.... OMG!!! OMG!!! DUDE!!! SERIOUSLY--DUDES!! NO WAY!! NONONONONONO!!! LET'S GTFOutta' HERE NOOOWW, BROS'!!!" *** BAHAHAHHAHAHAAHA!! *** Ya' just gotta love Aaron, lol. I know the entities sure do seem to love him. ;) *evil grin* >:->There is one place that I would LOVELOVELOVELOVE to see these guys journey to and explore INSIDE & OUT! They would LOVE that 'assignment.' It would be absolutely EPIC!! I'm talking about "The Prison of All Prisons." ALCATRAZ. Now that would be a HUGE dream come true for me, because I've actually visited Alcatraz. I swear to God, I felt so many eyes glaring at me the entire time... watching my every.single.move. (and they weren't the other tourists, either! The energy in that place was SO DARK, SO HEAVY, and SO... DISTURBING. It was just FREAKIN' DEPRESSING!! :( I remember dragging my feet, and wandering around just like a zombie after being in there for a while. I noticed that pretty much ALL of the other tourists were looking and acting the exact-same way. :O Afterwards, my friend and I were talking (and taking pictures :P) with a few of the guards who were working that day--And YEP!! They knew ALL TOO WELL just how haunted that isolated "rock" and abandoned prison was. Especially once the sun went down.We all know it! Zak, Nick, and Aaron are ALWAYS on top of their game, and KICK MAJOR GHOST TAIL!! IMO, there is NO other Paranormal Investigation Series that even comes CLOSE to these "dudes"!! I won't even bother to watch any of the other paranormal shows out there. KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK GUYS! Seriously... THE BEST OF THE BEST right here! Get all the seasons today! You will not regret it! ;)P.S.  Also (to the ladies)... Zak is SO FREAKIN' HAWT when he gets pissed, LOL!*Giggle -- PPpppuuuuuuuurrrrrrrrrrr* <3 <3 <3:D

reviewText: Ghost Adventures is one of the BEST shows out of the Paranormal.By watching this show from the START of Season 1 I can definately tell this show is in NO WAY Staged/Faked or garbage...It is the REAL-DEAL !I like the fact that Ghost Adventures ALWAYS provide REAL Evidence before they are quick to say a place is Haunted or has Parnormal Activity such as Ghosts/Demons.This is awesome Entertainment to watch if you are into the Paranormal.I HIGHLY suggest you purchase all the Seasons of this show and watch it from the START.You will NOT be dissapointed.I can't wait for Season 5 & 6 to come to DVD to add to my collection.Thanks Amazon for another satisfied Purchase !!!
